class.name: FixedMaterial
class.brief_description: Simple Material with a fixed parameter set.
class.description: FixedMaterial is a simple type of material [Resource], which contains a fixed amount of parameters. It is the only type of material supported in fixed-pipeline devices and APIs. It is also an often a better alternative to [ShaderMaterial] for most simple use cases.

method.name: get_parameter
method.description: Return a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: get_texcoord_mode
method.description: Return the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Return a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: get_uv_transform
method.description: Returns the special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xform texcoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM.

method.name: set_parameter
method.description: Set a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: set_texcoord_mode
method.description: Set the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Set a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: set_uv_transform
method.description: Sets a special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xform texcoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM.

constants.constant: Specular Lighting (light reflected from the surface).
Emission Lighting (light emitted from the surface).
Specular Exponent (size of the specular dot).
Read texture coordinates from the UV array.
Read texture coordinates from the UV array and transform them by uv_xform.
Read texture coordinates from the UV2 array.
